snippet: Eleven days after Avonte Oquendo vanished after leaving the Riverview School, a lawyer for the family and advocates said they were troubled by a mystery: How did the 14-year-old get out of the school to begin with?
abstract: David H Perecman, lawyer for family of Avonte Oquendo, 14-year-old autistic boy who vanished after leaving his school in Long Island City, Queens, says he is troubled by mystery of how he got out of school; says he and advocates for special-education students want more information on adults supervising Avonte; Schools Chancellor Dennis Walcott has said episode has prompted review of protocols and procedures.

byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Eleven days after Avonte Oquendo vanished after leaving the Riverview School, a lawyer for the family and advocates said they were troubled by a mystery: How did the 14-year-old get out of the school to begin with?

headline.main: As Search Goes On for Queens Boy With Autism, Adults at His School Face Questions
headline.print_headline: As Search Goes On for Queens Boy With Autism, Adults at His School Face Questions
